name: Coronation of Oscar I
obverse: Busts of Oscar I and Josephine of Leuchtenberg facing right. Both of them are crowned.
obverse_inscriptions: OSCAR I ET JOSEPHINA SCEN. NORVEG. GOTH. VAND. REX ET REGINA.
reverse: Two female figures clasping hands and looking at each other. The one on the left is seated and is holding a hand mirror. The one on the right is standing and holding a scale. In between the two figures is an altar with a crown and sceptre resting on top. To the right is a lion, paw resting on a sphere with the Three Crowns of Sweden.
reverse_inscriptions: IN MEMOR. FESTI CORONAT. HOLMIAE DIE XXVII SEPT. MDCCCXLIV. ORDD. REGNI SVEC. F.F.
description: Oscar I (born Joseph François Oscar Bernadotte; 4 July 1799 – 8 July 1859) was King of Sweden and Norway from 1844 to his death. His coronation occurred on September 28, 1844 in Stockholm. He was married to Josephine of Leuchtenberg.
